Detailed Description

Correctly rendering Thai text needs font hints, i.e. information on where to place characters and their diacritics. Every Thai font needs these hints, which are configured in Config/FontConfig.hpp and are retrieved by calling
See also:
FontConfig::GetThaiFontHints.
In general, font hinting has to be done by hand.

Field Documentation

XYDIM ThaiTextRenderer::ThaiFontHint::m_above_level_y_offset
 

Offsets for diacritics. The values are in the columns are: [0] - x-offset for above level, or kerning distance for characters in group LV (0x0E42, 0x0E43, 0x0E44). For others not in group LV, these are offsets so that the right edge of the diacritic can be placed correctly on the top level. Some diacritics are right-aligned to the modified consonant's right edge, some must be placed so that they overshoot the consonant's right edge. [1] - y-offset for above level. A correction factor for some diacritics so that when they are placed on the above level, they are correctly aligned and do not obscure the consonant. [2] - y-offset correction factor if the character is on above level and another is placed on top level. [3] - x-correction factor for diacritics used in conjunction with a CONS having an ascender. [4] - x-correction factor for diacritics when placed above 0x0E2C. Rows [0 ... 18] are for: 0x0E31, 0x0E34, 0x0E35, 0x0E36, 0x0E37, 0x0E38, 0x0E39, 0x0E3A, 0x0E47, 0x0E48, 0x0E49, 0x0E4A, 0x0E4B, 0x0E4C, 0x0E4D, 0x0E4E, 0x0E42, 0x0E43, and 0x0E44.

XYDIM(* ThaiTextRenderer::ThaiFontHint::m_cons_offsets)[46]
 

XYDIM(* ThaiTextRenderer::ThaiFontHint::m_diacritics_offsets)[19][5]
 

Offsets where - in general - diacritics need to be placed in relation to the glyph's right border. Specifies the distance from the left edge of the consonant's glyph to where the right edge of the diacritic placed above the consonant should be. This usually corresponds to the character's width (a glyph is usually wider than the character, as it is a block that may have a pixel or two on the left and right side). However, for some characters this does not correspond, and must be determined by hand.

XYDIM ThaiTextRenderer::ThaiFontHint::m_lo_chula_y_offset
 

Y-offset for "top" level.

XYDIM ThaiTextRenderer::ThaiFontHint::m_mai_tho_toplevel_x_offset
 

Y-offset for diacritics placed over character 0x0E2C (LO CHULA). Diacritics need to be drawn over ascender.

XYDIM ThaiTextRenderer::ThaiFontHint::m_tho_than_diacritic_lines
 

Specifies how many lines must be erased in the 0x0E0D (YO YING) glyph to eliminate its below diacritic. Counted from the glyph's bottom.

XYDIM ThaiTextRenderer::ThaiFontHint::m_top_level_y_offset
 

Y-offset for "above" level.

XYDIM ThaiTextRenderer::ThaiFontHint::m_yo_ying_diacritic_lines
 

X-offset for character 0x0E49 (MAI THO). The Thai diacritic MAI THO needs to be shifted to the right if it is placed on the top level; this correction factor determines the amount it is moved to the right.
